title: Understanding Valence Electrons
text: Valence electrons are the electrons in the outermost shell of an atom. They play a key role in chemical reactions and bonding.

title: Identifying the Electron Configuration Pattern
text: The electron configuration $$s^2 p^5$$ indicates that there are $$7$$ electrons in the outermost shell. This is one electron short of a full octet.

title: Locating the Group on the Periodic Table
text: Look for elements that are one electron short of having a full outer shell. These elements are highly reactive and are found in a specific group on the periodic table.

title: Identifying the Group
text: Which group of elements is known for having $$7$$ valence electrons, making them highly reactive and one electron short of a full octet?
